name: desulfurisation of hard coal flue gas | SOx retained, in hard coal flue gas desulfurisation | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/7758/documentation

This dataset represents the service of flue-gas desulfurisation of hard coal flue gas (wet lime scrubbing with limestone). There are about 30 different ways of desulfurisation of hard coal flue gas. About 85% of the installed capacity of desulfurisation plants are installed as scrubber with lime (CaO) or limestone (CaCO3) (Vernon et al. 1990). The current proportion of desulfurisation with limestone is estimated with 80%. Limestone has a low reactivity, but is preferred to quicklime (CaO) and slaked lime (Ca(OH)2 for economic reasons (IIP 1990). In this dataset, a wet lime scrubbing with limestone is modeled, so that the gases SO2, SO3, HCl and HF are being absorbed in a scrubbing solution with CaCO3 as absorber.;;The process steps are the detergent treatment, the absorption of flue gas components in the scrubbing suspension, the oxidation to sulfate (HSO3- to SO4-), the neutralization of the water suspension by the addition of limestone, crystallization of the gypsum, separation of the gypsum crystal from the mother liquor, calcination, pelleting or briquetting of gypsum for further use (IPP 1990, Baum 1988).;;The sulfur dioxide (SO2) is precipitated as wet calcium sulfite (CaSO3) and can then be converted to gypsum (CaSO4 * 2H2O) through forced oxidation. Total reaction is the following:;CaCO3 + 2 H2O + SO2 + 0.5 O2 --> CaSO4 * 2H2O + CO2;;The de-dusted flue gas is either cooled in a pre-scrubber or directly cooled in the absorber. There, the hydrogen halides, the residual dust particulates and up to 20% of the SO2 are washed out. The suspension from the pre-scrubber can also be removed separately. Thus, mixing with the gypsum can be prevented. Droplet separators retain entrained liquid droplets and the clean gas is reheated and discharged through the chimney. By air intake oxidation is encouraged in the scrubber sump to form the gypsum. ;The pH-value, the ratio of the absorption liquid to the amount of exhaust gas and the concentration of absorption liquid significantly affect the separation efficiency. ;;Sources:; - Vernon, J.L., Soud, H.N. (1990). FGD installations on coal-fired plants. IEA Coal Research, London; - IIP Karlsruhe, Ministerium für Umwelt Baden-Württemberg (1990). Entsorgung von Reststoffen aus der Rauchgasreinigung; Teil 2: TA-Luft-Feuerungsanlagen. Karlsruhe; - Baum, F. (1988). Luftreinhaltung in der Praxis. München, Deutschland.

Desulfurisation process starting with the operation of a hard coal power plant and receipt of the main input materials which are decarbonised water, lime, quicklime, sulfuric acid and sodium hydroxide.

This activity ends with 1kg retained SOx in the form of gypsum resulting from the flue gas desulfurisation process of a coal power plant. The reference product is therefore the service of retaining 1kg of sulfur from the hard coal flue gas with the by-product gypsum.

This dataset includes the operation of a wet scrubber. It includes material input, emissions and solid waste. Own use of electricity and heat is included in the net efficiency of the power plant using the desulfurisation process.
This dataset includes the by-product gypsum, which is directly available for further use.

This dataset does not include a specific treatment of the wastewater containing many elements and compounds.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: In (Hövelmann 1987) an efficiency of 95% is quantified. In other sources, this value is estimated at 80%. The efficiency of the desulfurisation has to reach 90 % in large-scale power plants in the European Union so that this has been taken as representative value. Dry lime scrubbing only reaches efficiencies of 70 to 80% and is used in smaller units. ;;Hövelmann, A. (1987). Neue Entsorgungsprobleme kohlegefeuerter Kraftwerke. Jül-2172, KFA Jülich.  ;;References:;Vernon J.L., Soud H.N. (1990) FGD installations on coal-fired plants. IEA Coal Research, London.;IIP Karlsruhe, Ministerium für Umwelt Baden-Württemberg (1990) Entsorgung von Reststoffen aus der Rauchgasreinigung; Teil 2: TA Luft-Feuerungsanlagen. Karlsruhe.;Baum F. (1988) Luftreinhaltung in der Praxis. München, Deutschland.;Hövelmann A. (1987) Neue Entsorgungsprobleme kohlegefeuerter Kraftwerke. Jül-2172, KFA Jülich.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

The dataset only takes into account one possible desulfurisation technology out of about 30 technologies; but this technology is the dominating way of desulfurisation, widely installed and used. 

Old data from around 1990 have been extrapolated up until 2000. The annual production volume has been calculated with a parameter value from 2008.

Estimation. Data and discharge limits for wastewater emissions are mainly taken from Germany. 

Further references:
Bambauer H.U., Gebhard G., Holzapfel Th., Krause Ch., Willner G. (1988) Schadstoff-Immobilisierung in Stabilisaten aus Braunkohleaschen und REA-Produkten. In: Fortschr. Miner. 66, 2, s.253-290. Stuttgart.
Grünewald K.G., Dettmann P., Fassbänder M., Jahn P. (1991) Bau- und Betriebserfahrungen mit der ersten abwasserfreien Pilot-Anlage zur REA-Abwasseraufbereitung mit Wertstoffrückgewinnung. VGB Kraftwerk und Umwelt.
Kyte W.S. (1991) Waste and Water Issues. Proceedings "Coal in the Environment", London.
Syring H. (1990) REA-Abwasser-Beseitigung. In: VGB-Seminar "Rauchgasreinigung und Reststoffentsorgung in Kraftwerken, Industrie- und Heizkraftwerken, Cottbus.


see also Tab. 9.34, p.126 in Röder et al. (2007): Konzentrationen von Ionen des REA-Abwassers vor und nach der Reinigung mit ARA und für diese Projekt gewählt Werte. 
The table is a compilation of different sources and shows the values chosen for this dataset.

Estimation. According to (Hövelmann 1987) 1.6 tons of limestone (CaCO3) per ton of SO2 is needed for a hard coal power plant (750 MW). The reaction equation of the limestone process is CaCO3 + 2H2O + SO2 + _O2 -> CaSO4 • 2H2O + CO2. It can be derived that stoichiometrically 1.56 kg of limestone is necessary and 0.69 kg of CO2 is produced per kg of SO2.

Further references:
Hövelmann A. (1987) Neue Entsorgungsprobleme kohlegefeuerter Kraftwerke. Jül-2172, KFA Jülich.
Uerpmann E.-P. (1990) Betriebserfahrungen mit nasser Rauchgasentschwefelung in Braunkohlekraftwerken. In: VGB-Seminar Rauchgasreinigung und Reststoffentsorgung in Kraftwerken, Industrie- und Heizkraftwerken. Cottbus, Deutschland.

see also Tab. 9.32 (Verschiedene REA-Bilanzen aus diversen Quellen) and Tab. 9.33, p.126f in Röder et al. (2007): REA-Massenbilanz pro kg reduziertes SO2, REA-Nass nach Tab. 9.33, REA-Nass Brk-D (Nass-Entschwefelung der westdeutschen Braunkohlekraftwerke) 

The tables are compilations of different sources for wet flue-gas desulfurisation mass-balances. Tab.9.33 shows the mass balance values chosen for this dataset.

exchanges.description:
Literature value. 5 kg waste water per kg SO2 retained, containing all emissions to water in this dataset. An average sewage is assumed, which is a simplification. Initial input of water was 20kg; the remaining parts are in the gypsum, the sludge and in the air. 
This water can be used for humidification of the ash and is then disposed off together with the ash (Gebhard et al. 1989).

Tab. 9.32 (Verschiedene REA-Bilanzen aus diversen Quellen) and Tab. 9.33, p.126f in Röder et al. (2007): REA-Massenbilanz pro kg reduziertes SO2, REA-Nass nach Tab. 9.33, REA-Nass Brk-D (Nass-Entschwefelung der westdeutschen Braunkohlekraftwerke). The tables are compilations of different sources for wet flue-gas desulfurisation mass-balances. Tab.9.33 shows the mass balance values chosen for this dataset. 

Gebhard G., Lukas W., Bambauer H.U. (1989) Stabilisierung von Rückständen aus der Braunkohleentschwefelung. In: VGB Kraftwerkstechnik 69, Heft 4, 1989, s.384-392.

Literature value. In the wastewater of the desulfurisation plant radioactive elements occur and must be detected. The radiation activities of these elements are not very relevant and the maximum values can be significantly (factor 10) higher.

see also Tab. 9.35, p.127 in Röder et al. (2007): Radioaktive Elemente im REA-Abwasser und REA-Schlamm eines Steinkohlekraftwerkes (Hövelmann 1987).
The table is a compilation of radioactive elements in the wastewater and sewage sludge of the flue gas desulfurisation.

Estimation. The radiation activity of the sludge is not negligible and, depending on the substance around 20-80 Bq kg per kg of separated SO2 respectively 10-50 kBq per TJin. The sludge is treated respectively disposed.

Further references:
Hövelmann A. (1987) Neue Entsorgungsprobleme kohlegefeuerter Kraftwerke. Jül-2172, KFA Jülich.

Literature value. The gypsum (CaSO2 * 2H2O) contains the retained sulfur and a certain amount of the input water. Gypsum resulting from wet lime scrubbing shows impurities of up to 6% (Calcite, CaCl2, Fluoride, flue ash, clays, silicates, quartz, ferric oxide, dolomite, siderite) (IIP 1990). Still, the quality of the gypsum is high enough so that it can be sold on the market. 

Tab. 9.32 (Verschiedene REA-Bilanzen aus diversen Quellen) and Tab. 9.33, p.126f in Röder et al. (2007): REA-Massenbilanz pro kg reduziertes SO2, REA-Nass nach Tab. 9.33, REA-Nass Brk-D (Nass-Entschwefelung der westdeutschen Braunkohlekraftwerke). The tables are compilations of different sources for wet flue-gas desulfurisation mass-balances. Tab.9.33 shows the mass balance values chosen for this dataset. 

Source: 
IIP Karlsruhe, Ministerium für Umwelt Baden-Württemberg (1990). Entsorgung von Reststoffen aus der Rauchgasreinigung; Teil 2: TA Luft-Feuerungsanlagen. Karlsruhe]

Literature value. 5 kg waste water per kg SO2 retained, containing all emissions to water in this dataset. An average sewage is assumed, which is a simplification. Initial input of water was 20kg; the remaining parts are in the gypsum, the sludge and in the air. 
This water can be used for humidification of the ash and is then disposed off together with the ash (Gebhard et al. 1989).

Estimation. According to (Hövelmann 1987) 1.6 tons of limestone (CaCO3) per ton of SO2 is needed for a hard coal power plant (750 MW). The reaction equation of the limestone process is CaCO3 + 2H2O + SO2 + _O2 -> CaSO4 • 2H2O + CO2. It can be derived that stoichiometrically 1.56 kg of limestone is necessary and 0.69 kg of CO2 is produced per kg of SO2.

Further references:
Hövelmann A. (1987) Neue Entsorgungsprobleme kohlegefeuerter Kraftwerke. Jül-2172, KFA Jülich.
Uerpmann E.-P. (1990) Betriebserfahrungen mit nasser Rauchgasentschwefelung in Braunkohlekraftwerken. In: VGB-Seminar Rauchgasreinigung und Reststoffentsorgung in Kraftwerken, Industrie- und Heizkraftwerken. Cottbus, Deutschland.

exchanges.description:
Estimation. Data and discharge limits for wastewater emissions are mainly taken from Germany. 

Further references:
Bambauer H.U., Gebhard G., Holzapfel Th., Krause Ch., Willner G. (1988) Schadstoff-Immobilisierung in Stabilisaten aus Braunkohleaschen und REA-Produkten. In: Fortschr. Miner. 66, 2, s.253-290. Stuttgart.
Grünewald K.G., Dettmann P., Fassbänder M., Jahn P. (1991) Bau- und Betriebserfahrungen mit der ersten abwasserfreien Pilot-Anlage zur REA-Abwasseraufbereitung mit Wertstoffrückgewinnung. VGB Kraftwerk und Umwelt.
Kyte W.S. (1991) Waste and Water Issues. Proceedings "Coal in the Environment", London.
Syring H. (1990) REA-Abwasser-Beseitigung. In: VGB-Seminar "Rauchgasreinigung und Reststoffentsorgung in Kraftwerken, Industrie- und Heizkraftwerken, Cottbus.


see also Tab. 9.34, p.126 in Röder et al. (2007): Konzentrationen von Ionen des REA-Abwassers vor und nach der Reinigung mit ARA und für diese Projekt gewählt Werte. 
The table is a compilation of different sources and shows the values chosen for this dataset.

Estimation. The radiation activity of the sludge is not negligible and, depending on the substance around 20-80 Bq kg per kg of separated SO2 respectively 10-50 kBq per TJin. The sludge is treated respectively disposed.

Further references:
Hövelmann A. (1987) Neue Entsorgungsprobleme kohlegefeuerter Kraftwerke. Jül-2172, KFA Jülich.
Uerpmann E.-P. (1990) Betriebserfahrungen mit nasser Rauchgasentschwefelung in Braunkohlekraftwerken. In: VGB-Seminar Rauchgasreinigung und Reststoffentsorgung in Kraftwerken, Industrie- und Heizkraftwerken. Cottbus, Deutschland.

see also Tab. 9.32 (Verschiedene REA-Bilanzen aus diversen Quellen) and Tab. 9.33, p.126f in Röder et al. (2007): REA-Massenbilanz pro kg reduziertes SO2, REA-Nass nach Tab. 9.33, REA-Nass Brk-D (Nass-Entschwefelung der westdeutschen Braunkohlekraftwerke) 

The tables are compilations of different sources for wet flue-gas desulfurisation mass-balances. Tab.9.33 shows the mass balance values chosen for this dataset.
